name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Independence Park Hotel

reviews.text: With an excellent location, friendly and efficient staff, and well-appointed rooms, there is not much else to ask for (well maybe a parking garage). I would stay here again without hesitation.
reviews.title: Nice historic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great hotel in heart of old town philadelphia. close to liberty bell, independence hall, and everything else you would want to see. stayed in historic hotel on weekend and it was a little noisy since our room was facing chestnut street. rooms were nice, breakfast was nice, and cookies and coffee or tea in afternoon was awesome. beds were very comfortable.overall great place to stay in heart of old historic philidelphia.
reviews.title: history of old town philadelphia

reviews.text: This hotel is amazingly close to all the historic sites in old city. The front desk staff was very helpful and found me the best way to get back to the airport without me asking them to. It is clean and the bed was very comfortable. Daily breakfast is good feature. I wish they had a gym.
reviews.title: Could not have asked for better

reviews.text: Spent a week here for work and truly enjoyed the hotel. The location was perfect and while the rooms aren't huge, they are a nice size for a historic hotel. My favorite part is that the windows still open so you can listen to the city if you like. I had an issue with my room the first day and the staff was great in getting me into a new room as soon as they could. They were very helpful in giving advice and even at the end being so good as to send me my computer charger (which I forgot like an idiot). I loved the special touch with the bill (a rolled copy of the Declaration!). I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants to be right in the center of Olde City.
reviews.title: Historic Hotel & wonderful staff.

reviews.text: Small, friendly and close to historic sites. Nice touches. Great breakfast and cookies and tea in afternoon. Good for couples or families.
reviews.title: Quaint historic hotel in the heart of Old Town Philadelphia

reviews.text: Unexpected cozy boutique-like hotel in a perfect location for historic sight-seeing. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast adequate, would have been great with the addition of yogurt. Nice touch is the constant bowl of fruit in the lobby. Our double-queen room was big enough for the three of us. Fridge was a convenience, and plenty of single-brew coffee in the room was nice. Temperature easily controlled (was initially too hot). We stayed here because the hotel we were hoping to book was full, but I am glad we did. Would definitely recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Cozy hotel, perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our overnight stay at the Best Western Plus Independence Park Hotel. The room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The convenient location to many downtown attractions was also a big plus.
reviews.title: Great hotel experience

reviews.text: This hotel is full of mold and truly run down.
reviews.title: Full of Mold

reviews.text: The staff may be friendly but i got very ill upon entering my matchbox room.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I had to leave the hotel because of a reaction to the mold.
reviews.title: Charming historic building in an excellent location. Recommend this one!

reviews.text: Hotel was well located for the historic sites. Staff were friendly and accommodated our early arrival. The room was ample sized but a little dated. Breakfast was incredible-make your own waffles was a great idea. Would highly recommend to others.
reviews.title: Great location, AMAZING breakfast!!

reviews.text: This hotel was fantastic and I will be returning on all future trips to Philadelphia. It is an incredibly charming, historic building in the perfect location to enjoy the historic landmarks of Phladelphia. Good, safe, central location. The room was clean and comfortable, reminded me of a boutique European hotel. The staff was outstanding, always friendly and helpful. For example, I was late for the (complimentary!) afternoon tea and cookies and they actually went to the trouble to pull the tea back out for me, without me even asking. Overall extremely friendly and homey experience.
reviews.title: Charming Hotel!

reviews.text: The only negative was the lack of wireless internet throughout the hotel. The internet is complimentary, but wired only in the hotel rooms and wireless in the lobby. A tiny issue in an otherwise great experience. I'll be recommending this hotel to my family and friends.
reviews.title: Friendly staff, comfortable beds, historical place, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is an all-around excellent place to stay, as it is much smaller and more charming than the other hotels I've stayed at in Philly. The staff are very friendly and helpful, and you get a sense of "home" there because of the accommodating staff, cozy front lounge with fireplace, small "inn" atmosphere and the amenities you get for the price you pay, which is well worth it. First, the hotel is fitting of the historical area it is in, as it is decked out in antique/traditional furniture. The front lounge serves tea and delicious fresh-baked cookies in the early evening and you can enjoy these sitting in a comfy sofa in front of a crackling fireplace. I saw that there was a computer with printer, board games and tables and chairs for relaxing or meeting up with friends or colleagues before hitting the town or going up to bed. The rooms were not huge, but the beds were very comfortable (not too soft or too firm, a good "medium"), and the bathroom was spotlessly clean. We had a room with 2 double beds, which we paid more for, but your only choices were 1 queen or 1 king in a room if traveling with friends. There were only "wired-in" Internet in the rooms, and wireless in the lobby which didn't work. The only fault I can find was that the Internet was REAL slow in the rooms, but as we weren't there in the rooms so long, it was enough for checking e-mail and Facebooking. Breakfast was EXCELLENT and was included in the rate, and if they have a special, they throw in hot breakfast in the buffet. They had DIY waffles with syrup (both regular and sugar-free syrups!), scrambled eggs, tasty sausages, toast, danish, cereals, jams, butter, juices, fruit and yogurt. The staff at breakfast were very thoughtful and since we came in late for breakfast (ends at 10:30, and we walked in at 10:15!), they asked if we wanted more sausages since they were out of it. We didn't feel rushed at all and so we left a nice tip for the lady there. Also, one of the ladies at the front who works nights ordered my sister a cab at 3:30am and said that they make sure that the cab is a regular and that they feel comfortable using this person for women traveling solo. Again, very thoughtful and a nice gesture!
reviews.title: nice hotel and great service

reviews.text: About the area, it is by many historical areas, bars, clubs, and some restaurants. There weren't many cheap fast food areas nearby, but the front desk person directed us to an excellent Philly cheesesteak place and boy, was that amazingly good! There is a convenience/grocery store about 2 blocks away on 2nd and Market St. and about a block away is Cosi which has counterservice/fast food like atmosphere. The restaurants in the area are pretty expensive, but cater more to the tourist crowd, so you'll have to travel a bit to get to more local type, affordable places.
reviews.title: Great location but no parking

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We came to Philadelphia to celebrate our 50th wedding anniversary by seeing the historic sites and visiting the museums (Philadelphia Museum of Art, PAFA). Our choice of the hotel was based on location, size, and charm of an historic property. The rooms were comfortable and quiet and clean. The breakfast was fulsome and the skylit eating area pleasant. The location was perfect: close to the historic sites and the #38 bus to center city and the art museums, on a block filled with good restaurants and a lively scene. The staff was courteous, welcoming, informative and proactive in making ce3rtain that all was well with the guests.
reviews.title: Perfect for our 50th Anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First I want to thank the staff of this establishment. They were extremely helpful and gave fantastic recommendations for the local area. The rooms were clean and quiet, breakfast was delicious and the location was perfect for nightlife. I'm just boning to say the gift shop next door was a charming experience. Thanks for the great visit to Philly. Look forward to seeing you again.
reviews.title: Best time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can't beat this location - walkable to everything, especially the historic sites. I especially enjoyed walking through the Society Hill District, down Third Street to South Street on a quiet Sunday morning. When we were there, they were running a special so the usual Continental breakfast had the addition of hot food - eggs, sausage, waffles. There's alway fruit in the lobby, wonderful cookies for afternoon tea, and the lobby is an inviting place to sit with its comfortable sofas, fireplace, and game table. The entire staff couldn't have been nicer. We arrived late in the evening and the woman at registration got us cookies from afternoon tea. The breakfast wait staff was so accomodating. All staff seemed to be knowledgeable about the area. The room was very clean and well-kept, a refrigerator, microwave, and easily adjustable heat. Parking is at a garage two half-blocks away - $18 per 24 hours, no in and out. You don't want to drive in Philly anyway -- little convenient parking.
reviews.title: Not your average Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Best Western Independence Park is a boutique hotel in what is obviously a lovingly restored and maintained historic building. My husband and I particularly enjoyed the ambiance being consistent with the overall vibe of the historic district - it really adds something to the Philadelphia tourism experience.
reviews.title: Great hotel in an ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is very convenient to tourist attractions like the Liberty Bell, Constitution Center, and Independence Hall, and Chestnut Street is lined with a multitude of dining and drinking options. The staff are friendly and very helpful - clearly well-trained and obviously take a great deal of pride in their work. The room was very clean, the bathroom was sparkling, and the bed was comfortable. The ipod docking station was a nice surprise, also.
reviews.title: Perfect location

description: If you’re planning to “Visit Philly” this summer, be sure to stay the night at the Independence Park Hotel. We’re located in Philadelphia’s Historic District and the perfect spot to explore the city, catch a ball game, enjoy a show or just have fun! Stay with us and walk to the Liberty Bell, Independence Hall, Ben Franklin’s Post Office, Betsy Ross’s House, the National Constitution Center and Penn’s Landing. Plus, there are dozens of great restaurants, art galleries and museums to wander through in our historic neighborhood. And if you’re in Philadelphia on business, you will love our convenient location, free high speed Internet, complimentary 24/7 business pulse center and our award winning and pretty delicious complimentary continental breakfast. We are close to many corporate and government headquarters, as well as universities and renowned hospitals. Stay a night or longer and when you do, we promise to take good care of you. So, relax and enjoy our stunning architecture and host of complimentary modern comforts, designed to exceed today's demanding traveler needs. Make the most of your visit to Philadelphia, stay at Independence Park Hotel. Come be our guest!
